member.name: M:UniRx.CompositeDisposable.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with no disposables contained by it initially.

member.name: M:UniRx.CompositeDisposable.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified number of disposables.
member.param: The number of disposables that the new CompositeDisposable can initially store.

member.name: M:UniRx.CompositeDisposable.#ctor(System.IDisposable[])
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class from a group of disposables.
member.param: Disposables that will be disposed together.

member.name: M:UniRx.CompositeDisposable.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.IDisposable})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class from a group of disposables.
member.param: Disposables that will be disposed together.

member.name: P:UniRx.CompositeDisposable.Count
member.summary: Gets the number of disposables contained in the CompositeDisposable.

member.name: M:UniRx.CompositeDisposable.Add(System.IDisposable)
member.summary: Adds a disposable to the CompositeDisposable or disposes the disposable if the CompositeDisposable is disposed.
member.param: Disposable to add.

member.name: M:UniRx.CompositeDisposable.Remove(System.IDisposable)
member.summary: Removes and disposes the first occurrence of a disposable from the CompositeDisposable.
member.param: Disposable to remove.
member.returns: true if found; false otherwise.

member.name: M:UniRx.CompositeDisposable.Dispose
member.summary: Disposes all disposables in the group and removes them from the group.

member.name: M:UniRx.CompositeDisposable.Clear
member.summary: Removes and disposes all disposables from the CompositeDisposable, but does not dispose the CompositeDisposable.

member.name: M:UniRx.CompositeDisposable.Contains(System.IDisposable)
member.summary: Determines whether the CompositeDisposable contains a specific disposable.
member.param: Disposable to search for.
member.returns: true if the disposable was found; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:UniRx.CompositeDisposable.CopyTo(System.IDisposable[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Copies the disposables contained in the CompositeDisposable to an array, starting at a particular array index.
member.param: Array to copy the contained disposables to.
Target index at which to copy the first disposable of the group.
member.exception: is less than zero. -or - is larger than or equal to the array length.

member.name: P:UniRx.CompositeDisposable.IsReadOnly
member.summary: Always returns false.

member.name: M:UniRx.CompositeDisposable.GetEnumerator
member.summary: Returns an enumerator that iterates through the CompositeDisposable.
member.returns: An enumerator to iterate over the disposables.

member.summary: Returns an enumerator that iterates through the CompositeDisposable.
member.returns: An enumerator to iterate over the disposables.

member.summary: Add disposable(self) to CompositeDisposable(or other ICollection). Return value is self disposable.

member.name: T:UniRx.RefCountDisposable
member.summary: Represents a disposable resource that only disposes its underlying disposable resource when all dependent disposable objects have been disposed.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified disposable.
member.param: Underlying disposable.

member.name: P:UniRx.RefCountDisposable.IsDisposed
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the object is disposed.

member.name: M:UniRx.RefCountDisposable.GetDisposable
member.summary: Returns a dependent disposable that when disposed decreases the refcount on the underlying disposable.
member.returns: A dependent disposable contributing to the reference count that manages the underlying disposable's lifetime.

member.name: M:UniRx.RefCountDisposable.Dispose
member.summary: Disposes the underlying disposable only when all dependent disposables have been disposed.

member.name: T:UniRx.InternalUtil.AsyncLock
member.summary: Asynchronous lock.

member.name: M:UniRx.InternalUtil.AsyncLock.Wait(System.Action)
member.summary: Queues the action for execution. If the caller acquires the lock and becomes the owner, the queue is processed. If the lock is already owned, the action is queued and will get processed by the owner.
member.param: Action to queue for execution.

member.name: M:UniRx.InternalUtil.AsyncLock.Dispose
member.summary: Clears the work items in the queue and drops further work being queued.

member.name: T:UniRx.InternalUtil.MicroCoroutine
member.summary: Simple supports(only yield return null) lightweight, threadsafe coroutine dispatcher.

member.name: T:UniRx.InternalUtil.ScheduledItem
member.summary: Abstract base class for scheduled work items.

member.name: M:UniRx.InternalUtil.ScheduledItem.#ctor(System.Action,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Creates a new scheduled work item to run at the specified time.
member.param: Absolute time at which the work item has to be executed.

member.name: P:UniRx.InternalUtil.ScheduledItem.DueTime
member.summary: Gets the absolute time at which the item is due for invocation.

member.name: M:UniRx.InternalUtil.ScheduledItem.Invoke
member.summary: Invokes the work item.

member.name: M:UniRx.InternalUtil.ScheduledItem.CompareTo(UniRx.InternalUtil.ScheduledItem)
member.summary: Compares the work item with another work item based on absolute time values.
member.param: Work item to compare the current work item to.
member.returns: Relative ordering between this and the specified work item.
member.remarks: The inequality operators are overloaded to provide results consistent with the IComparable implementation. Equality operators implement traditional reference equality semantics.

member.name: M:UniRx.InternalUtil.ScheduledItem.op_LessThan(UniRx.InternalUtil.ScheduledItem,UniRx.InternalUtil.ScheduledItem)
member.summary: Determines whether one specified ScheduledItem<TAbsolute> object is due before a second specified ScheduledItem<TAbsolute> object.
member.param: The first object to compare.
The second object to compare.
member.returns: true if the DueTime value of left is earlier than the DueTime value of right; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This operator provides results consistent with the IComparable implementation.

member.name: M:UniRx.InternalUtil.ScheduledItem.op_LessThanOrEqual(UniRx.InternalUtil.ScheduledItem,UniRx.InternalUtil.ScheduledItem)
member.summary: Determines whether one specified ScheduledItem<TAbsolute> object is due before or at the same of a second specified ScheduledItem<TAbsolute> object.
member.param: The first object to compare.
The second object to compare.
member.returns: true if the DueTime value of left is earlier than or simultaneous with the DueTime value of right; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This operator provides results consistent with the IComparable implementation.

member.name: M:UniRx.InternalUtil.ScheduledItem.op_GreaterThan(UniRx.InternalUtil.ScheduledItem,UniRx.InternalUtil.ScheduledItem)
member.summary: Determines whether one specified ScheduledItem<TAbsolute> object is due after a second specified ScheduledItem<TAbsolute> object.
member.param: The first object to compare.
The second object to compare.
member.returns: true if the DueTime value of left is later than the DueTime value of right; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This operator provides results consistent with the IComparable implementation.

member.name: M:UniRx.InternalUtil.ScheduledItem.op_GreaterThanOrEqual(UniRx.InternalUtil.ScheduledItem,UniRx.InternalUtil.ScheduledItem)
member.summary: Determines whether one specified ScheduledItem<TAbsolute> object is due after or at the same time of a second specified ScheduledItem<TAbsolute> object.
member.param: The first object to compare.
The second object to compare.
member.returns: true if the DueTime value of left is later than or simultaneous with the DueTime value of right; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This operator provides results consistent with the IComparable implementation.

member.name: M:UniRx.InternalUtil.ScheduledItem.op_Equality(UniRx.InternalUtil.ScheduledItem,UniRx.InternalUtil.ScheduledItem)
member.summary: Determines whether two specified ScheduledItem<TAbsolute, TValue> objects are equal.
member.param: The first object to compare.
The second object to compare.
member.returns: true if both ScheduledItem<TAbsolute, TValue> are equal; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This operator does not provide results consistent with the IComparable implementation. Instead, it implements reference equality.

member.name: M:UniRx.InternalUtil.ScheduledItem.op_Inequality(UniRx.InternalUtil.ScheduledItem,UniRx.InternalUtil.ScheduledItem)
member.summary: Determines whether two specified ScheduledItem<TAbsolute, TValue> objects are inequal.
member.param: The first object to compare.
The second object to compare.
member.returns: true if both ScheduledItem<TAbsolute, TValue> are inequal; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This operator does not provide results consistent with the IComparable implementation. Instead, it implements reference equality.

member.name: M:UniRx.InternalUtil.ScheduledItem.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Determines whether a ScheduledItem<TAbsolute> object is equal to the specified object.
member.param: The object to compare to the current ScheduledItem<TAbsolute> object.
member.returns: true if the obj parameter is a ScheduledItem<TAbsolute> object and is equal to the current ScheduledItem<TAbsolute> object; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:UniRx.InternalUtil.ScheduledItem.GetHashCode
member.summary: Returns the hash code for the current ScheduledItem<TAbsolute> object.
member.returns: A 32-bit signed integer hash code.

member.name: P:UniRx.InternalUtil.ScheduledItem.IsCanceled
member.summary: Gets whether the work item has received a cancellation request.

member.name: T:UniRx.InternalUtil.SchedulerQueue
member.summary: Efficient scheduler queue that maintains scheduled items sorted by absolute time.
member.remarks: This type is not thread safe; users should ensure proper synchronization.

member.name: M:UniRx.InternalUtil.SchedulerQueue.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new scheduler queue with a default initial capacity.

member.name: M:UniRx.InternalUtil.SchedulerQueue.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creats a new scheduler queue with the specified initial capacity.
member.param: Initial capacity of the scheduler queue.

member.name: P:UniRx.InternalUtil.SchedulerQueue.Count
member.summary: Gets the number of scheduled items in the scheduler queue.

member.name: M:UniRx.InternalUtil.SchedulerQueue.Enqueue(UniRx.InternalUtil.ScheduledItem)
member.summary: Enqueues the specified work item to be scheduled.
member.param: Work item to be scheduled.

member.name: M:UniRx.InternalUtil.SchedulerQueue.Remove(UniRx.InternalUtil.ScheduledItem)
member.summary: Removes the specified work item from the scheduler queue.
member.param: Work item to be removed from the scheduler queue.
member.returns: true if the item was found; false otherwise.

member.name: M:UniRx.InternalUtil.SchedulerQueue.Dequeue
member.summary: Dequeues the next work item from the scheduler queue.
member.returns: Next work item in the scheduler queue (removed).

member.name: M:UniRx.InternalUtil.SchedulerQueue.Peek
member.summary: Peeks the next work item in the scheduler queue.
member.returns: Next work item in the scheduler queue (not removed).

The type of the result returned from the observer's notification handlers. This type parameter is covariant. That is, you can use either the type you specified or any type that is more derived. For more information about covariance and contravariance, see Covariance and Contravariance in Generics.

member.name: M:UniRx.Notification`1.Equals(UniRx.Notification{`0})
member.summary: Determines whether the current Notification<T> object has the same observer message payload as a specified Notification<T> value.
member.param: An object to compare to the current Notification<T> object.
member.returns: true if both Notification<T> objects have the same observer message payload; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: Equality of Notification<T> objects is based on the equality of the observer message payload they represent, including the notification Kind and the Value or Exception (if any). This means two Notification<T> objects can be equal even though they don't represent the same observer method call, but have the same Kind and have equal parameters passed to the observer method. In case one wants to determine whether two Notification<T> objects represent the same observer method call, use Object.ReferenceEquals identity equality instead.

member.name: M:UniRx.Notification`1.op_Equality(UniRx.Notification{`0},UniRx.Notification{`0})
member.summary: Determines whether the two specified Notification<T> objects have the same observer message payload.
member.param: The first Notification<T> to compare, or null.
The second Notification<T> to compare, or null.
member.returns: true if the first Notification<T> value has the same observer message payload as the second Notification<T> value; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: Equality of Notification<T> objects is based on the equality of the observer message payload they represent, including the notification Kind and the Value or Exception (if any). This means two Notification<T> objects can be equal even though they don't represent the same observer method call, but have the same Kind and have equal parameters passed to the observer method. In case one wants to determine whether two Notification<T> objects represent the same observer method call, use Object.ReferenceEquals identity equality instead.

member.name: M:UniRx.Notification`1.op_Inequality(UniRx.Notification{`0},UniRx.Notification{`0})
member.summary: Determines whether the two specified Notification<T> objects have a different observer message payload.
member.param: The first Notification<T> to compare, or null.
The second Notification<T> to compare, or null.
member.returns: true if the first Notification<T> value has a different observer message payload as the second Notification<T> value; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: Equality of Notification<T> objects is based on the equality of the observer message payload they represent, including the notification Kind and the Value or Exception (if any). This means two Notification<T> objects can be equal even though they don't represent the same observer method call, but have the same Kind and have equal parameters passed to the observer method. In case one wants to determine whether two Notification<T> objects represent a different observer method call, use Object.ReferenceEquals identity equality instead.

member.name: M:UniRx.Notification`1.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Determines whether the specified System.Object is equal to the current Notification<T>.
member.param: The System.Object to compare with the current Notification<T>.
member.returns: true if the specified System.Object is equal to the current Notification<T>; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: Equality of Notification<T> objects is based on the equality of the observer message payload they represent, including the notification Kind and the Value or Exception (if any). This means two Notification<T> objects can be equal even though they don't represent the same observer method call, but have the same Kind and have equal parameters passed to the observer method. In case one wants to determine whether two Notification<T> objects represent the same observer method call, use Object.ReferenceEquals identity equality instead.

member.name: T:UniRx.Notification
member.summary: Provides a set of static methods for constructing notifications.

member.name: M:UniRx.Notification.CreateOnNext``1(``0)
member.summary: Creates an object that represents an OnNext notification to an observer.
member.typeparam: The type of the elements received by the observer. Upon dematerialization of the notifications into an observable sequence, this type is used as the element type for the sequence.
member.param: The value contained in the notification.
member.returns: The OnNext notification containing the value.

member.name: M:UniRx.Notification.CreateOnError``1(System.Exception)
member.summary: Creates an object that represents an OnError notification to an observer.
member.typeparam: The type of the elements received by the observer. Upon dematerialization of the notifications into an observable sequence, this type is used as the element type for the sequence.
member.param: The exception contained in the notification.
member.returns: The OnError notification containing the exception.

member.name: M:UniRx.Notification.CreateOnCompleted``1
member.summary: Creates an object that represents an OnCompleted notification to an observer.
member.typeparam: The type of the elements received by the observer. Upon dematerialization of the notifications into an observable sequence, this type is used as the element type for the sequence.
member.returns: The OnCompleted notification.
